arm_group.description: Patients and spouses in the intervention group are offered 3 targeted meetings with the DBS nurse, focusing on goal setting for each individual, following DBS, based on patients and spouses own expectations, challenges and goals for everyday life after DBS.
Patients and spouses enrolled in a control group

brief_summary.textblock:
Parkinson's disease is a chronic progressive neurological disorder. Symptoms are tremor,
      slowness in movement, rigidity and postural instability. As the disease progresses and
      treatment with L-dopa is no longer sufficient, some patients may be treated with deep brain
      stimulation.

      When treated with deep brain stimulation, electrodes are inserted in the affected area of
      the brain and through stimulation, motor symptoms of Parkinson's disease are significantly
      reduced.

      During the first year of DBS treatment patients and spouses may experience changes in
      everyday life and illness trajectory posing new opportunities as well as new challenges.

      The purpose of the study is to develop an individualised and targeted nursing program to
      support patients and relatives manage changes and challenges in life the first three months
      after Deep Brain Stimulation. The intervention is expected to generate important knowledge
      that will serve as a foundation for the further development of a future nursing program.

clinical_study.brief_title: Managing Changes in Life After Deep Brain Stimulation for Parkinson's Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  eligible and offered treatment with DBS for PD

          -  married or cohabitant

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  living alone

facility.name: Department of Neurology, Aarhus University Hospital
Department of Neurology , Aarhus University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Managing Changes in Life After Deep Brain Stimulation for Parkinson's Disease - Designing and Developing a Targeted Nursing Program to Patients and Spouses.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in sense of Coherence in intervention group compared to control group

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: Institute of public health, department of nursing sciences, Århus University, Denmark
